meanings.definition: A man whose wife has committed adultery.
meanings.sent1: The poor cuckold felt betrayed by his unfaithful wife.
meanings.sent2: The cuckold was heartbroken when he discovered his wife's affair.
meanings.sent3: The gossip in town was that the local cuckold had been deceived by his spouse.
meanings.sent4: Being a cuckold was like having your heart ripped out and stomped on.
meanings.sent5: The image of the cuckolded man haunted her dreams.

meanings.definition: To make a cuckold of (a husband).
meanings.sent1: She planned to cuckold her husband with his best friend.
meanings.sent2: He feared that his wife might cuckold him with a charming stranger.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous plan to cuckold him was set in motion.
meanings.sent4: Her actions would cuckold him and shatter their marriage.
meanings.sent5: The betrayal would cuckold him and leave him brokenhearted.

meanings.definition: A man married to an unfaithful wife.
meanings.sent1: The poor cuckold had to endure the shame of his wife's infidelity.
meanings.sent2: He was known in the village as the cuckold married to a cheating woman.
meanings.sent3: The town's gossip revolved around the unfortunate cuckold and his wayward spouse.
meanings.sent4: Living as a cuckold was like being trapped in a never-ending nightmare.
meanings.sent5: The image of the cuckolded husband lingered in everyone's minds.
